Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CM5 (Ctriporin analog G4K,G8K,S11K,A12K,T14K, Lys-rich, synthetic AMPs20a, UCLL1; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (73.68%) toCtriporinK: 37%, I=L: 16%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC29213 or ATCC25923 MRSA (MIC 1.8 uM), E. faecium ATCC29212 (MIC 3.5 uM), E. coli ATCC25922 or ATCC35218 (MIC 1.8-3.5 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC 1.8 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC 3.5 uM), A. baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 0.9 uM).In vitro toxicity:  human RBC: HC50> 500 ug/ml. 20% hemolysis at 500 ug/ml, poor hemo.lytic.MOA:bacteria:A. baumannii: membrane permeation.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 30 mM SDS micelles.
Literature Information.Author: Luo X, Deng H, Ding L, Ye X, Sun F, Qin C, Chen Z.2024
Literature Information.Title: Cationicity Enhancement on the Hydrophilic Face of Ctriporin Significantly Reduces Its Hemolytic Activity and Improves the Antimicrobial Activity against Antibiotic-Resistant ESKAPE Pathogens.
